param
Inserting parameter(s) into the algorithm. Usually used in conjunction with functions that include parameters (for example:
script
,
algWithParams
,
filterAlg
).
Syntax
name
Setting
Purpose
name
Selecting the parameter created in the current algorithm profile.
Note
To insert a parameter it is necessary to create it in the current algorithm profile. To do this, click the
button on the special panel and select "Object parameters" in the opened window:
After that, in the modal window that opens, specify the characteristics of the created parameter:
You can add a function to the code of the algorithm using the
button, located in the Algorithm editor on the "Sources" tab.
The parameter must be the right argument, in case it is compared to a different value.
Example
The filter algorithm for the crop ID is presented in the following form:
The
attr
function is used to insert a chain attribute.
The parameter is inserted with the
param
function.
When calling the filter algorithm with
filterAlg
, the parameter will be automatically applied:
